<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.addw" title="algopy.op.addw"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">addw</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>A plus B as a 128-bit result. X is the carry-bit, Y is the low-order 64 bits.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.app_opted_in" title="algopy.op.app_opted_in"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">app_opted_in</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>1 if account A is opted in to application B, else 0
params: Txn.Accounts offset (or, since v4, an <em>available</em> account address), <em>available</em> application id (or, since v4, a Txn.ForeignApps offset). Return: 1 if opted in and 0 otherwise.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.arg" title="algopy.op.arg"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">arg</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>Ath LogicSig argument</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.balance" title="algopy.op.balance"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">balance</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>balance for account A, in microalgos. The balance is observed after the effects of previous transactions in the group, and after the fee for the current transaction is deducted. Changes caused by inner transactions are observable immediately following <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">itxn_submit</span></code>
params: Txn.Accounts offset (or, since v4, an <em>available</em> account address), <em>available</em> application id (or, since v4, a Txn.ForeignApps offset). Return: value.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.base64_decode" title="algopy.op.base64_decode"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">base64_decode</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>decode A which was base64-encoded using <em>encoding</em> E. Fail if A is not base64 encoded with encoding E
<em>Warning</em>: Usage should be restricted to very rare use cases. In almost all cases, smart contracts should directly handle non-encoded byte-strings. This opcode should only be used in cases where base64 is the only available option, e.g. interoperability with a third-party that only signs base64 strings.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.bitlen" title="algopy.op.bitlen"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">bitlen</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>The highest set bit in A. If A is a byte-array, it is interpreted as a big-endian unsigned integer. bitlen of 0 is 0, bitlen of 8 is 4
bitlen interprets arrays as big-endian integers, unlike setbit/getbit</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.bsqrt" title="algopy.op.bsqrt"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">bsqrt</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>The largest integer I such that I^2 &lt;= A. A and I are interpreted as big-endian unsigned integers</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.btoi" title="algopy.op.btoi"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">btoi</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>converts big-endian byte array A to uint64. Fails if len(A) &gt; 8. Padded by leading 0s if len(A) &lt; 8.
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">btoi</span></code> fails if the input is longer than 8 bytes.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.bzero" title="algopy.op.bzero"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">bzero</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>zero filled byte-array of length A</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.concat" title="algopy.op.concat"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">concat</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>join A and B
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">concat</span></code> fails if the result would be greater than 4096 bytes.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.divmodw" title="algopy.op.divmodw"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">divmodw</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>W,X = (A,B / C,D); Y,Z = (A,B modulo C,D)
The notation J,K indicates that two uint64 values J and K are interpreted as a uint128 value, with J as the high uint64 and K the low.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.divw" title="algopy.op.divw"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">divw</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>A,B / C. Fail if C == 0 or if result overflows.
The notation A,B indicates that A and B are interpreted as a uint128 value, with A as the high uint64 and B the low.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.ecdsa_pk_decompress" title="algopy.op.ecdsa_pk_decompress"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ecdsa_pk_decompress</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>decompress pubkey A into components X, Y

</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.ecdsa_pk_recover" title="algopy.op.ecdsa_pk_recover"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ecdsa_pk_recover</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>for (data A, recovery id B, signature C, D) recover a public key
S (top) and R elements of a signature, recovery id and data (bottom) are expected on the stack and used to deriver a public key. All values are big-endian encoded. The signed data must be 32 bytes long.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.ecdsa_verify" title="algopy.op.ecdsa_verify"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ecdsa_verify</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>for (data A, signature B, C and pubkey D, E) verify the signature of the data against the pubkey =&gt; {0 or 1}
The 32 byte Y-component of a public key is the last element on the stack, preceded by X-component of a pubkey, preceded by S and R components of a signature, preceded by the data that is fifth element on the stack. All values are big-endian encoded. The signed data must be 32 bytes long, and signatures in lower-S form are only accepted.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.ed25519verify" title="algopy.op.ed25519verify"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ed25519verify</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>for (data A, signature B, pubkey C) verify the signature of (“ProgData” || program_hash || data) against the pubkey =&gt; {0 or 1}
The 32 byte public key is the last element on the stack, preceded by the 64 byte signature at the second-to-last element on the stack, preceded by the data which was signed at the third-to-last element on the stack.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.ed25519verify_bare" title="algopy.op.ed25519verify_bare"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ed25519verify_bare</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>for (data A, signature B, pubkey C) verify the signature of the data against the pubkey =&gt; {0 or 1}</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.err" title="algopy.op.err"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">err</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>Fail immediately.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.exit" title="algopy.op.exit"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">exit</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>use A as success value; end</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.exp" title="algopy.op.exp"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">exp</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>A raised to the Bth power. Fail if A == B == 0 and on overflow</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.expw" title="algopy.op.expw"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">expw</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>A raised to the Bth power as a 128-bit result in two uint64s. X is the high 64 bits, Y is the low. Fail if A == B == 0 or if the results exceeds 2^128-1</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.extract" title="algopy.op.extract"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">extract</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>A range of bytes from A starting at B up to but not including B+C. If B+C is larger than the array length, the program fails
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">extract3</span></code> can be called using <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">extract</span></code> with no immediates.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.extract_uint16" title="algopy.op.extract_uint16"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">extract_uint16</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>A uint16 formed from a range of big-endian bytes from A starting at B up to but not including B+2. If B+2 is larger than the array length, the program fails</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.extract_uint32" title="algopy.op.extract_uint32"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">extract_uint32</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>A uint32 formed from a range of big-endian bytes from A starting at B up to but not including B+4. If B+4 is larger than the array length, the program fails</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.extract_uint64" title="algopy.op.extract_uint64"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">extract_uint64</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>A uint64 formed from a range of big-endian bytes from A starting at B up to but not including B+8. If B+8 is larger than the array length, the program fails</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.gaid" title="algopy.op.gaid"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">gaid</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>ID of the asset or application created in the Ath transaction of the current group
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">gaids</span></code> fails unless the requested transaction created an asset or application and A &lt; GroupIndex.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.getbit" title="algopy.op.getbit"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">getbit</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>Bth bit of (byte-array or integer) A. If B is greater than or equal to the bit length of the value (8*byte length), the program fails
see explanation of bit ordering in setbit</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.getbyte" title="algopy.op.getbyte"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">getbyte</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>Bth byte of A, as an integer. If B is greater than or equal to the array length, the program fails</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.gload_bytes" title="algopy.op.gload_bytes"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">gload_bytes</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>Bth scratch space value of the Ath transaction in the current group</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.gload_uint64" title="algopy.op.gload_uint64"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">gload_uint64</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>Bth scratch space value of the Ath transaction in the current group</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.itob" title="algopy.op.itob"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">itob</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>converts uint64 A to big-endian byte array, always of length 8</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.keccak256" title="algopy.op.keccak256"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">keccak256</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>Keccak256 hash of value A, yields [32]byte</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.min_balance" title="algopy.op.min_balance"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">min_balance</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>minimum required balance for account A, in microalgos. Required balance is affected by ASA, App, and Box usage. When creating or opting into an app, the minimum balance grows before the app code runs, therefore the increase is visible there. When deleting or closing out, the minimum balance decreases after the app executes. Changes caused by inner transactions or box usage are observable immediately following the opcode effecting the change.
params: Txn.Accounts offset (or, since v4, an <em>available</em> account address), <em>available</em> application id (or, since v4, a Txn.ForeignApps offset). Return: value.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.mulw" title="algopy.op.mulw"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">mulw</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>A times B as a 128-bit result in two uint64s. X is the high 64 bits, Y is the low</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.replace" title="algopy.op.replace"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">replace</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>Copy of A with the bytes starting at B replaced by the bytes of C. Fails if B+len(C) exceeds len(A)
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">replace3</span></code> can be called using <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">replace</span></code> with no immediates.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.select_bytes" title="algopy.op.select_bytes"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">select_bytes</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>selects one of two values based on top-of-stack: B if C != 0, else A</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.select_uint64" title="algopy.op.select_uint64"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">select_uint64</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>selects one of two values based on top-of-stack: B if C != 0, else A</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.setbit_bytes" title="algopy.op.setbit_bytes"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">setbit_bytes</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>Copy of (byte-array or integer) A, with the Bth bit set to (0 or 1) C. If B is greater than or equal to the bit length of the value (8*byte length), the program fails
When A is a uint64, index 0 is the least significant bit. Setting bit 3 to 1 on the integer 0 yields 8, or 2^3. When A is a byte array, index 0 is the leftmost bit of the leftmost byte. Setting bits 0 through 11 to 1 in a 4-byte-array of 0s yields the byte array 0xfff00000. Setting bit 3 to 1 on the 1-byte-array 0x00 yields the byte array 0x10.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.setbit_uint64" title="algopy.op.setbit_uint64"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">setbit_uint64</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>Copy of (byte-array or integer) A, with the Bth bit set to (0 or 1) C. If B is greater than or equal to the bit length of the value (8*byte length), the program fails
When A is a uint64, index 0 is the least significant bit. Setting bit 3 to 1 on the integer 0 yields 8, or 2^3. When A is a byte array, index 0 is the leftmost bit of the leftmost byte. Setting bits 0 through 11 to 1 in a 4-byte-array of 0s yields the byte array 0xfff00000. Setting bit 3 to 1 on the 1-byte-array 0x00 yields the byte array 0x10.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.setbyte" title="algopy.op.setbyte"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">setbyte</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>Copy of A with the Bth byte set to small integer (between 0..255) C. If B is greater than or equal to the array length, the program fails</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.sha256" title="algopy.op.sha256"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sha256</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>SHA256 hash of value A, yields [32]byte</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.sha3_256" title="algopy.op.sha3_256"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sha3_256</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>SHA3_256 hash of value A, yields [32]byte</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.sha512_256" title="algopy.op.sha512_256"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sha512_256</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>SHA512_256 hash of value A, yields [32]byte</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.shl" title="algopy.op.shl"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">shl</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>A times 2^B, modulo 2^64</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.shr" title="algopy.op.shr"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">shr</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>A divided by 2^B</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.sqrt" title="algopy.op.sqrt"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sqrt</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>The largest integer I such that I^2 &lt;= A</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-odd"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.substring" title="algopy.op.substring"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">substring</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>A range of bytes from A starting at B up to but not including C. If C &lt; B, or either is larger than the array length, the program fails</p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="row-even"><td><p><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.vrf_verify" title="algopy.op.vrf_verify"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vrf_verify</span></code></a></p></td>
<td><p>Verify the proof B of message A against pubkey C. Returns vrf output and verification flag.
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">VrfAlgorand</span></code> is the VRF used in Algorand. It is ECVRF-ED25519-SHA512-Elligator2, specified in the IETF internet draft <a class="reference external" href="https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-irtf-cfrg-vrf/03/">draft-irtf-cfrg-vrf-03</a>.</p></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<dl class="py method">

<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">center</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.center" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a centered string of length width.</p>
<p>Padding is done using the specified fill character (default is a space).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.count">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">count</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.count" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.count(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the number of non-overlapping occurrences of substring sub in
string S[start:end].  Optional arguments start and end are
interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.encode">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">encode</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.encode" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Encode the string using the codec registered for encoding.</p>
<p>encoding
The encoding in which to encode the string.
errors
The error handling scheme to use for encoding errors.
The default is ‘strict’ meaning that encoding errors raise a
UnicodeEncodeError.  Other possible values are ‘ignore’, ‘replace’ and
‘xmlcharrefreplace’ as well as any other name registered with
codecs.register_error that can handle UnicodeEncodeErrors.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.endswith">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">endswith</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.endswith" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.endswith(suffix[, start[, end]]) -&gt; bool</p>
<p>Return True if S ends with the specified suffix, False otherwise.
With optional start, test S beginning at that position.
With optional end, stop comparing S at that position.
suffix can also be a tuple of strings to try.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.expandtabs">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">expandtabs</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.expandtabs" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy where all tab characters are expanded using spaces.</p>
<p>If tabsize is not given, a tab size of 8 characters is assumed.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.find">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">find</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.find" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.find(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the lowest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Return -1 on failure.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.format">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">format</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.format" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.format(*args, **kwargs) -&gt; str</p>
<p>Return a formatted version of S, using substitutions from args and kwargs.
The substitutions are identified by braces (‘{’ and ‘}’).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.format_map">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">format_map</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.format_map" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.format_map(mapping) -&gt; str</p>
<p>Return a formatted version of S, using substitutions from mapping.
The substitutions are identified by braces (‘{’ and ‘}’).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.index">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">index</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.index" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.index(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the lowest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Raises ValueError when the substring is not found.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.isalnum">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isalnum</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.isalnum" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is an alpha-numeric string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is alpha-numeric if all characters in the string are alpha-numeric and
there is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.isalpha">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isalpha</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.isalpha" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is an alphabetic string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is alphabetic if all characters in the string are alphabetic and there
is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.isascii">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isascii</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.isascii" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if all characters in the string are ASCII, False otherwise.</p>
<p>ASCII characters have code points in the range U+0000-U+007F.
Empty string is ASCII too.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.isdecimal">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isdecimal</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.isdecimal" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a decimal string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is a decimal string if all characters in the string are decimal and
there is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.isdigit">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isdigit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.isdigit" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a digit string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is a digit string if all characters in the string are digits and there
is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.isidentifier">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isidentifier</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.isidentifier" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a valid Python identifier, False otherwise.</p>
<p>Call keyword.iskeyword(s) to test whether string s is a reserved identifier,
such as “def” or “class”.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.islower">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">islower</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.islower" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a lowercase string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is lowercase if all cased characters in the string are lowercase and
there is at least one cased character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.isnumeric">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isnumeric</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.isnumeric" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a numeric string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is numeric if all characters in the string are numeric and there is at
least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.isprintable">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isprintable</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.isprintable" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is printable, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is printable if all of its characters are considered printable in
repr() or if it is empty.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.isspace">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isspace</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.isspace" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a whitespace string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is whitespace if all characters in the string are whitespace and there
is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.istitle">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">istitle</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.istitle" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a title-cased string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>In a title-cased string, upper- and title-case characters may only
follow uncased characters and lowercase characters only cased ones.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.isupper">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isupper</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.isupper" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is an uppercase string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is uppercase if all cased characters in the string are uppercase and
there is at least one cased character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.join">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">join</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.join" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Concatenate any number of strings.</p>
<p>The string whose method is called is inserted in between each given string.
The result is returned as a new string.</p>
<p>Example: ‘.’.join([‘ab’, ‘pq’, ‘rs’]) -&gt; ‘ab.pq.rs’</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.ljust">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">ljust</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.ljust" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a left-justified string of length width.</p>
<p>Padding is done using the specified fill character (default is a space).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.lower">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">lower</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.lower" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string converted to lowercase.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.lstrip">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">lstrip</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.lstrip" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string with leading whitespace removed.</p>
<p>If chars is given and not None, remove characters in chars instead.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.partition">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">partition</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.partition" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Partition the string into three parts using the given separator.</p>
<p>This will search for the separator in the string.  If the separator is found,
returns a 3-tuple containing the part before the separator, the separator
itself, and the part after it.</p>
<p>If the separator is not found, returns a 3-tuple containing the original string
and two empty strings.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.removeprefix">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">removeprefix</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.removeprefix" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a str with the given prefix string removed if present.</p>
<p>If the string starts with the prefix string, return string[len(prefix):].
Otherwise, return a copy of the original string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.removesuffix">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">removesuffix</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.removesuffix" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a str with the given suffix string removed if present.</p>
<p>If the string ends with the suffix string and that suffix is not empty,
return string[:-len(suffix)]. Otherwise, return a copy of the original
string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.replace">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">replace</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.replace" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy with all occurrences of substring old replaced by new.</p>
<p>count
Maximum number of occurrences to replace.
-1 (the default value) means replace all occurrences.</p>
<p>If the optional argument count is given, only the first count occurrences are
replaced.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.rfind">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rfind</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.rfind" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.rfind(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the highest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Return -1 on failure.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.rindex">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rindex</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.rindex" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.rindex(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the highest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Raises ValueError when the substring is not found.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.rjust">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rjust</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.rjust" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a right-justified string of length width.</p>
<p>Padding is done using the specified fill character (default is a space).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.rpartition">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rpartition</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.rpartition" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Partition the string into three parts using the given separator.</p>
<p>This will search for the separator in the string, starting at the end. If
the separator is found, returns a 3-tuple containing the part before the
separator, the separator itself, and the part after it.</p>
<p>If the separator is not found, returns a 3-tuple containing two empty strings
and the original string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.rsplit">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rsplit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.rsplit" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a list of the substrings in the string, using sep as the separator string.</p>
<p>sep
The separator used to split the string.</p>
<div class="highlight-none notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>When set to None (the default value), will split on any whitespace
character (including \n \r \t \f and spaces) and will discard
empty strings from the result.
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>maxsplit
Maximum number of splits.
-1 (the default value) means no limit.</p>
<p>Splitting starts at the end of the string and works to the front.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.rstrip">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rstrip</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.rstrip" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string with trailing whitespace removed.</p>
<p>If chars is given and not None, remove characters in chars instead.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.split">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">split</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.split" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a list of the substrings in the string, using sep as the separator string.</p>
<p>sep
The separator used to split the string.</p>
<div class="highlight-none notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>When set to None (the default value), will split on any whitespace
character (including \n \r \t \f and spaces) and will discard
empty strings from the result.
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>maxsplit
Maximum number of splits.
-1 (the default value) means no limit.</p>
<p>Splitting starts at the front of the string and works to the end.</p>
<p>Note, str.split() is mainly useful for data that has been intentionally
delimited.  With natural text that includes punctuation, consider using
the regular expression module.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.splitlines">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">splitlines</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.splitlines" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a list of the lines in the string, breaking at line boundaries.</p>
<p>Line breaks are not included in the resulting list unless keepends is given and
true.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.startswith">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">startswith</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.startswith" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.startswith(prefix[, start[, end]]) -&gt; bool</p>
<p>Return True if S starts with the specified prefix, False otherwise.
With optional start, test S beginning at that position.
With optional end, stop comparing S at that position.
prefix can also be a tuple of strings to try.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.strip">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">strip</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.strip" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string with leading and trailing whitespace removed.</p>
<p>If chars is given and not None, remove characters in chars instead.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.swapcase">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">swapcase</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.swapcase" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Convert uppercase characters to lowercase and lowercase characters to uppercase.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.title">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">title</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.title" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a version of the string where each word is titlecased.</p>
<p>More specifically, words start with uppercased characters and all remaining
cased characters have lower case.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.translate">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">translate</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.translate" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Replace each character in the string using the given translation table.</p>
<p>table
Translation table, which must be a mapping of Unicode ordinals to
Unicode ordinals, strings, or None.</p>
<p>The table must implement lookup/indexing via <strong>getitem</strong>, for instance a
dictionary or list.  If this operation raises LookupError, the character is
left untouched.  Characters mapped to None are deleted.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.upper">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">upper</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.upper" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string converted to uppercase.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.Base64.zfill">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">zfill</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.Base64.zfill" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Pad a numeric string with zeros on the left, to fill a field of the given width.</p>
<p>The string is never truncated.</p>
</dd></dl>

</dd></dl>

<dd><p>set box A to contain its previous bytes up to index B, followed by D, followed by the original bytes of A that began at index B+C.

<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__reduce__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.__reduce__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Helper for pickle.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.__reduce_ex__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__reduce_ex__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.__reduce_ex__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Helper for pickle.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.__repr__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__repr__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.__repr__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return repr(self).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.__rmod__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__rmod__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.__rmod__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return value%self.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.__rmul__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__rmul__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.__rmul__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return value*self.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.__setattr__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__setattr__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.__setattr__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Implement setattr(self, name, value).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.__sizeof__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__sizeof__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.__sizeof__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return the size of the string in memory, in bytes.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.__str__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__str__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.__str__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return str(self).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.capitalize">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">capitalize</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.capitalize" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a capitalized version of the string.</p>
<p>More specifically, make the first character have upper case and the rest lower
case.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.casefold">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">casefold</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.casefold" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a version of the string suitable for caseless comparisons.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.center">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">center</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.center" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a centered string of length width.</p>
<p>Padding is done using the specified fill character (default is a space).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.count">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">count</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.count" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.count(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the number of non-overlapping occurrences of substring sub in
string S[start:end].  Optional arguments start and end are
interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.encode">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">encode</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.encode" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Encode the string using the codec registered for encoding.</p>
<p>encoding
The encoding in which to encode the string.
errors
The error handling scheme to use for encoding errors.
The default is ‘strict’ meaning that encoding errors raise a
UnicodeEncodeError.  Other possible values are ‘ignore’, ‘replace’ and
‘xmlcharrefreplace’ as well as any other name registered with
codecs.register_error that can handle UnicodeEncodeErrors.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.endswith">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">endswith</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.endswith" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.endswith(suffix[, start[, end]]) -&gt; bool</p>
<p>Return True if S ends with the specified suffix, False otherwise.
With optional start, test S beginning at that position.
With optional end, stop comparing S at that position.
suffix can also be a tuple of strings to try.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.expandtabs">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">expandtabs</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.expandtabs" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy where all tab characters are expanded using spaces.</p>
<p>If tabsize is not given, a tab size of 8 characters is assumed.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.find">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">find</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.find" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.find(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the lowest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Return -1 on failure.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.format">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">format</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.format" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.format(*args, **kwargs) -&gt; str</p>
<p>Return a formatted version of S, using substitutions from args and kwargs.
The substitutions are identified by braces (‘{’ and ‘}’).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.format_map">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">format_map</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.format_map" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.format_map(mapping) -&gt; str</p>
<p>Return a formatted version of S, using substitutions from mapping.
The substitutions are identified by braces (‘{’ and ‘}’).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.index">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">index</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.index" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.index(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the lowest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Raises ValueError when the substring is not found.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.isalnum">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isalnum</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.isalnum" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is an alpha-numeric string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is alpha-numeric if all characters in the string are alpha-numeric and
there is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.isalpha">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isalpha</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.isalpha" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is an alphabetic string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is alphabetic if all characters in the string are alphabetic and there
is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.isascii">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isascii</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.isascii" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if all characters in the string are ASCII, False otherwise.</p>
<p>ASCII characters have code points in the range U+0000-U+007F.
Empty string is ASCII too.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.isdecimal">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isdecimal</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.isdecimal" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a decimal string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is a decimal string if all characters in the string are decimal and
there is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.isdigit">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isdigit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.isdigit" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a digit string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is a digit string if all characters in the string are digits and there
is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.isidentifier">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isidentifier</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.isidentifier" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a valid Python identifier, False otherwise.</p>
<p>Call keyword.iskeyword(s) to test whether string s is a reserved identifier,
such as “def” or “class”.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.islower">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">islower</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.islower" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a lowercase string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is lowercase if all cased characters in the string are lowercase and
there is at least one cased character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.isnumeric">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isnumeric</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.isnumeric" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a numeric string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is numeric if all characters in the string are numeric and there is at
least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.isprintable">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isprintable</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.isprintable" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is printable, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is printable if all of its characters are considered printable in
repr() or if it is empty.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.isspace">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isspace</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.isspace" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a whitespace string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is whitespace if all characters in the string are whitespace and there
is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.istitle">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">istitle</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.istitle" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a title-cased string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>In a title-cased string, upper- and title-case characters may only
follow uncased characters and lowercase characters only cased ones.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.isupper">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isupper</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.isupper" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is an uppercase string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is uppercase if all cased characters in the string are uppercase and
there is at least one cased character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.join">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">join</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.join" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Concatenate any number of strings.</p>
<p>The string whose method is called is inserted in between each given string.
The result is returned as a new string.</p>
<p>Example: ‘.’.join([‘ab’, ‘pq’, ‘rs’]) -&gt; ‘ab.pq.rs’</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.ljust">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">ljust</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.ljust" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a left-justified string of length width.</p>
<p>Padding is done using the specified fill character (default is a space).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.lower">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">lower</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.lower" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string converted to lowercase.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.lstrip">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">lstrip</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.lstrip" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string with leading whitespace removed.</p>
<p>If chars is given and not None, remove characters in chars instead.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.partition">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">partition</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.partition" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Partition the string into three parts using the given separator.</p>
<p>This will search for the separator in the string.  If the separator is found,
returns a 3-tuple containing the part before the separator, the separator
itself, and the part after it.</p>
<p>If the separator is not found, returns a 3-tuple containing the original string
and two empty strings.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.removeprefix">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">removeprefix</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.removeprefix" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a str with the given prefix string removed if present.</p>
<p>If the string starts with the prefix string, return string[len(prefix):].
Otherwise, return a copy of the original string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.removesuffix">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">removesuffix</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.removesuffix" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a str with the given suffix string removed if present.</p>
<p>If the string ends with the suffix string and that suffix is not empty,
return string[:-len(suffix)]. Otherwise, return a copy of the original
string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.replace">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">replace</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.replace" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy with all occurrences of substring old replaced by new.</p>
<p>count
Maximum number of occurrences to replace.
-1 (the default value) means replace all occurrences.</p>
<p>If the optional argument count is given, only the first count occurrences are
replaced.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.rfind">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rfind</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.rfind" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.rfind(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the highest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Return -1 on failure.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.rindex">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rindex</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.rindex" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.rindex(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the highest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Raises ValueError when the substring is not found.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.rjust">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rjust</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.rjust" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a right-justified string of length width.</p>
<p>Padding is done using the specified fill character (default is a space).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.rpartition">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rpartition</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.rpartition" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Partition the string into three parts using the given separator.</p>
<p>This will search for the separator in the string, starting at the end. If
the separator is found, returns a 3-tuple containing the part before the
separator, the separator itself, and the part after it.</p>
<p>If the separator is not found, returns a 3-tuple containing two empty strings
and the original string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.rsplit">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rsplit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.rsplit" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a list of the substrings in the string, using sep as the separator string.</p>
<p>sep
The separator used to split the string.</p>
<div class="highlight-none notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>When set to None (the default value), will split on any whitespace
character (including \n \r \t \f and spaces) and will discard
empty strings from the result.
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>maxsplit
Maximum number of splits.
-1 (the default value) means no limit.</p>
<p>Splitting starts at the end of the string and works to the front.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.rstrip">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rstrip</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.rstrip" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string with trailing whitespace removed.</p>
<p>If chars is given and not None, remove characters in chars instead.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.split">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">split</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.split" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a list of the substrings in the string, using sep as the separator string.</p>
<p>sep
The separator used to split the string.</p>
<div class="highlight-none notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>When set to None (the default value), will split on any whitespace
character (including \n \r \t \f and spaces) and will discard
empty strings from the result.
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>maxsplit
Maximum number of splits.
-1 (the default value) means no limit.</p>
<p>Splitting starts at the front of the string and works to the end.</p>
<p>Note, str.split() is mainly useful for data that has been intentionally
delimited.  With natural text that includes punctuation, consider using
the regular expression module.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.splitlines">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">splitlines</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.splitlines" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a list of the lines in the string, breaking at line boundaries.</p>
<p>Line breaks are not included in the resulting list unless keepends is given and
true.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">

<dd><p>S.startswith(prefix[, start[, end]]) -&gt; bool</p>
<p>Return True if S starts with the specified prefix, False otherwise.
With optional start, test S beginning at that position.
With optional end, stop comparing S at that position.
prefix can also be a tuple of strings to try.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.strip">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">strip</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.strip" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string with leading and trailing whitespace removed.</p>
<p>If chars is given and not None, remove characters in chars instead.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.swapcase">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">swapcase</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.swapcase" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Convert uppercase characters to lowercase and lowercase characters to uppercase.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.title">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">title</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.title" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a version of the string where each word is titlecased.</p>
<p>More specifically, words start with uppercased characters and all remaining
cased characters have lower case.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EC.translate">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">translate</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.translate" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Replace each character in the string using the given translation table.</p>
<p>table
Translation table, which must be a mapping of Unicode ordinals to
Unicode ordinals, strings, or None.</p>
<p>The table must implement lookup/indexing via <strong>getitem</strong>, for instance a
dictionary or list.  If this operation raises LookupError, the character is
left untouched.  Characters mapped to None are deleted.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">

<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">upper</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.upper" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>

<dl class="py method">

<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">zfill</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EC.zfill" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>

<p>The string is never truncated.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.count">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">count</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.count" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.count(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the number of non-overlapping occurrences of substring sub in
string S[start:end].  Optional arguments start and end are
interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.encode">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">encode</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.encode" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Encode the string using the codec registered for encoding.</p>
<p>encoding
The encoding in which to encode the string.
errors
The error handling scheme to use for encoding errors.
The default is ‘strict’ meaning that encoding errors raise a
UnicodeEncodeError.  Other possible values are ‘ignore’, ‘replace’ and
‘xmlcharrefreplace’ as well as any other name registered with
codecs.register_error that can handle UnicodeEncodeErrors.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.endswith">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">endswith</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.endswith" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.endswith(suffix[, start[, end]]) -&gt; bool</p>
<p>Return True if S ends with the specified suffix, False otherwise.
With optional start, test S beginning at that position.
With optional end, stop comparing S at that position.
suffix can also be a tuple of strings to try.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">

<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">expandtabs</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.expandtabs" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
