<p>If tabsize is not given, a tab size of 8 characters is assumed.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.find">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">find</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.find" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.find(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the lowest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Return -1 on failure.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.format">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">format</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.format" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.format(*args, **kwargs) -&gt; str</p>
<p>Return a formatted version of S, using substitutions from args and kwargs.
The substitutions are identified by braces (‘{’ and ‘}’).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.format_map">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">format_map</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.format_map" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.format_map(mapping) -&gt; str</p>
<p>Return a formatted version of S, using substitutions from mapping.
The substitutions are identified by braces (‘{’ and ‘}’).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.index">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">index</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.index" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.index(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the lowest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Raises ValueError when the substring is not found.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.isalnum">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isalnum</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.isalnum" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is an alpha-numeric string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is alpha-numeric if all characters in the string are alpha-numeric and
there is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.isalpha">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isalpha</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.isalpha" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is an alphabetic string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is alphabetic if all characters in the string are alphabetic and there
is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.isascii">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isascii</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.isascii" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if all characters in the string are ASCII, False otherwise.</p>
<p>ASCII characters have code points in the range U+0000-U+007F.
Empty string is ASCII too.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.isdecimal">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isdecimal</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.isdecimal" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a decimal string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is a decimal string if all characters in the string are decimal and
there is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.isdigit">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isdigit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.isdigit" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a digit string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is a digit string if all characters in the string are digits and there
is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.isidentifier">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isidentifier</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.isidentifier" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a valid Python identifier, False otherwise.</p>
<p>Call keyword.iskeyword(s) to test whether string s is a reserved identifier,
such as “def” or “class”.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.islower">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">islower</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.islower" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a lowercase string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is lowercase if all cased characters in the string are lowercase and
there is at least one cased character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.isnumeric">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isnumeric</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.isnumeric" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a numeric string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is numeric if all characters in the string are numeric and there is at
least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.isprintable">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isprintable</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.isprintable" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is printable, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is printable if all of its characters are considered printable in
repr() or if it is empty.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.isspace">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isspace</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.isspace" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a whitespace string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is whitespace if all characters in the string are whitespace and there
is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.istitle">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">istitle</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.istitle" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a title-cased string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>In a title-cased string, upper- and title-case characters may only
follow uncased characters and lowercase characters only cased ones.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.isupper">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isupper</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.isupper" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is an uppercase string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is uppercase if all cased characters in the string are uppercase and
there is at least one cased character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.join">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">join</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.join" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Concatenate any number of strings.</p>
<p>The string whose method is called is inserted in between each given string.
The result is returned as a new string.</p>
<p>Example: ‘.’.join([‘ab’, ‘pq’, ‘rs’]) -&gt; ‘ab.pq.rs’</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.ljust">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">ljust</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.ljust" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a left-justified string of length width.</p>
<p>Padding is done using the specified fill character (default is a space).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.lower">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">lower</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.lower" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string converted to lowercase.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.lstrip">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">lstrip</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.lstrip" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string with leading whitespace removed.</p>
<p>If chars is given and not None, remove characters in chars instead.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.partition">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">partition</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.partition" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Partition the string into three parts using the given separator.</p>
<p>This will search for the separator in the string.  If the separator is found,
returns a 3-tuple containing the part before the separator, the separator
itself, and the part after it.</p>
<p>If the separator is not found, returns a 3-tuple containing the original string
and two empty strings.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.removeprefix">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">removeprefix</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.removeprefix" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a str with the given prefix string removed if present.</p>
<p>If the string starts with the prefix string, return string[len(prefix):].
Otherwise, return a copy of the original string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.removesuffix">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">removesuffix</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.removesuffix" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a str with the given suffix string removed if present.</p>
<p>If the string ends with the suffix string and that suffix is not empty,
return string[:-len(suffix)]. Otherwise, return a copy of the original
string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.replace">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">replace</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.replace" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy with all occurrences of substring old replaced by new.</p>
<p>count
Maximum number of occurrences to replace.
-1 (the default value) means replace all occurrences.</p>
<p>If the optional argument count is given, only the first count occurrences are
replaced.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.rfind">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rfind</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.rfind" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.rfind(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the highest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Return -1 on failure.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.rindex">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rindex</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.rindex" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.rindex(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the highest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Raises ValueError when the substring is not found.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.rjust">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rjust</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.rjust" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a right-justified string of length width.</p>
<p>Padding is done using the specified fill character (default is a space).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.rpartition">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rpartition</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.rpartition" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Partition the string into three parts using the given separator.</p>
<p>This will search for the separator in the string, starting at the end. If
the separator is found, returns a 3-tuple containing the part before the
separator, the separator itself, and the part after it.</p>
<p>If the separator is not found, returns a 3-tuple containing two empty strings
and the original string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.rsplit">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rsplit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.rsplit" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a list of the substrings in the string, using sep as the separator string.</p>
<p>sep
The separator used to split the string.</p>
<div class="highlight-none notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>When set to None (the default value), will split on any whitespace
character (including \n \r \t \f and spaces) and will discard
empty strings from the result.
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>maxsplit
Maximum number of splits.
-1 (the default value) means no limit.</p>
<p>Splitting starts at the end of the string and works to the front.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.rstrip">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rstrip</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.rstrip" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string with trailing whitespace removed.</p>
<p>If chars is given and not None, remove characters in chars instead.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.split">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">split</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.split" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a list of the substrings in the string, using sep as the separator string.</p>
<p>sep
The separator used to split the string.</p>
<div class="highlight-none notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>When set to None (the default value), will split on any whitespace
character (including \n \r \t \f and spaces) and will discard
empty strings from the result.
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>maxsplit
Maximum number of splits.
-1 (the default value) means no limit.</p>
<p>Splitting starts at the front of the string and works to the end.</p>
<p>Note, str.split() is mainly useful for data that has been intentionally
delimited.  With natural text that includes punctuation, consider using
the regular expression module.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.splitlines">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">splitlines</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.splitlines" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a list of the lines in the string, breaking at line boundaries.</p>
<p>Line breaks are not included in the resulting list unless keepends is given and
true.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.startswith">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">startswith</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.startswith" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.startswith(prefix[, start[, end]]) -&gt; bool</p>
<p>Return True if S starts with the specified prefix, False otherwise.
With optional start, test S beginning at that position.
With optional end, stop comparing S at that position.
prefix can also be a tuple of strings to try.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.strip">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">strip</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.strip" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string with leading and trailing whitespace removed.</p>
<p>If chars is given and not None, remove characters in chars instead.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.swapcase">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">swapcase</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.swapcase" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Convert uppercase characters to lowercase and lowercase characters to uppercase.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.title">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">title</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.title" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a version of the string where each word is titlecased.</p>
<p>More specifically, words start with uppercased characters and all remaining
cased characters have lower case.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.translate">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">translate</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.translate" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Replace each character in the string using the given translation table.</p>
<p>table
Translation table, which must be a mapping of Unicode ordinals to
Unicode ordinals, strings, or None.</p>
<p>The table must implement lookup/indexing via <strong>getitem</strong>, for instance a
dictionary or list.  If this operation raises LookupError, the character is
left untouched.  Characters mapped to None are deleted.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.upper">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">upper</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.upper" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string converted to uppercase.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.ECDSA.zfill">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">zfill</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.ECDSA.zfill" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Pad a numeric string with zeros on the left, to fill a field of the given width.</p>
<p>The string is never truncated.</p>
</dd></dl>

</dd></dl>

<dl class="py class">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EllipticCurve">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">algopy.op.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">EllipticCurve</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EllipticCurve" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Elliptic Curve functions
Native TEAL ops: <a class="reference external" href="https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/dapps/avm/teal/opcodes/v10/#ec_add"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_add</span></code></a>, <a class="reference external" href="https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/dapps/avm/teal/opcodes/v10/#ec_map_to"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_map_to</span></code></a>, <a class="reference external" href="https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/dapps/avm/teal/opcodes/v10/#ec_multi_scalar_mul"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_multi_scalar_mul</span></code></a>, <a class="reference external" href="https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/dapps/avm/teal/opcodes/v10/#ec_pairing_check"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_pairing_check</span></code></a>, <a class="reference external" href="https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/dapps/avm/teal/opcodes/v10/#ec_scalar_mul"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_scalar_mul</span></code></a>, <a class="reference external" href="https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/dapps/avm/teal/opcodes/v10/#ec_subgroup_check"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_subgroup_check</span></code></a></p>
<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EllipticCurve.add">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">static</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">add</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span>

<dl>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">g</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.EC" title="algopy.op.EC"><span class="pre">algopy.op.EC</span></a></span></em>,</dd>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">a</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bytes</span></a></span></em>,</dd>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">b</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bytes</span></a></span></em>,</dd>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">/</span></span></em>,</dd>
</dl>

<span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EllipticCurve.add" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>for curve points A and B, return the curve point A + B
A and B are curve points in affine representation: field element X concatenated with field element Y. Field element <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Z</span></code> is encoded as follows.
For the base field elements (Fp), <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Z</span></code> is encoded as a big-endian number and must be lower than the field modulus.
For the quadratic field extension (Fp2), <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Z</span></code> is encoded as the concatenation of the individual encoding of the coefficients. For an Fp2 element of the form <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Z</span> <span class="pre">=</span> <span class="pre">Z0</span> <span class="pre">+</span> <span class="pre">Z1</span> <span class="pre">i</span></code>, where <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">i</span></code> is a formal quadratic non-residue, the encoding of Z is the concatenation of the encoding of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Z0</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Z1</span></code> in this order. (<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Z0</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Z1</span></code> must be less than the field modulus).</p>
<p>The point at infinity is encoded as <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">(X,Y)</span> <span class="pre">=</span> <span class="pre">(0,0)</span></code>.
Groups G1 and G2 are denoted additively.</p>
<p>Fails if A or B is not in G.
A and/or B are allowed to be the point at infinity.
Does <em>not</em> check if A and B are in the main prime-order subgroup.</p>
<dl class="myst field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><strong>g</strong> (<a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.EC" title="algopy.op.EC"><em>EC</em></a>) – curve index</p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Native TEAL opcode: <a class="reference external" href="https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/dapps/avm/teal/opcodes/v10/#ec_add"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_add</span></code></a></p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.EllipticCurve.map_to">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">static</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">map_to</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">g</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.EC" title="algopy.op.EC"><span class="pre">algopy.op.EC</span></a></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">a</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bytes</span></a></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">/</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EllipticCurve.map_to" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>maps field element A to group G
BN254 points are mapped by the SVDW map. BLS12-381 points are mapped by the SSWU map.
G1 element inputs are base field elements and G2 element inputs are quadratic field elements, with nearly the same encoding rules (for field elements) as defined in <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_add</span></code>. There is one difference of encoding rule: G1 element inputs do not need to be 0-padded if they fit in less than 32 bytes for BN254 and less than 48 bytes for BLS12-381. (As usual, the empty byte array represents 0.) G2 elements inputs need to be always have the required size.</p>
<dl class="myst field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><strong>g</strong> (<a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.EC" title="algopy.op.EC"><em>EC</em></a>) – curve index</p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Native TEAL opcode: <a class="reference external" href="https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/dapps/avm/teal/opcodes/v10/#ec_map_to"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_map_to</span></code></a></p>
</dd></dl>

<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">b</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bytes</span></a></span></em>,</dd>

<span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bool</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.EllipticCurve.pairing_check" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>1 if the product of the pairing of each point in A with its respective point in B is equal to the identity element of the target group Gt, else 0
A and B are concatenated points, encoded and checked as described in <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_add</span></code>. A contains points of the group G, B contains points of the associated group (G2 if G is G1, and vice versa). Fails if A and B have a different number of points, or if any point is not in its described group or outside the main prime-order subgroup - a stronger condition than other opcodes. AVM values are limited to 4096 bytes, so <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_pairing_check</span></code> is limited by the size of the points in the groups being operated upon.</p>

</dd>
</dl>
<p>Native TEAL opcode: <a class="reference external" href="https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/dapps/avm/teal/opcodes/v10/#ec_pairing_check"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_pairing_check</span></code></a></p>
</dd></dl>

<dd><p>for curve points A and scalars B, return curve point B0A0 + B1A1 + B2A2 + … + BnAn

The name <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_multi_scalar_mul</span></code> was chosen to reflect common usage, but a more consistent name would be <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_multi_scalar_mul</span></code>. AVM values are limited to 4096 bytes, so <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ec_multi_scalar_mul</span></code> is limited by the size of the points in the group being operated upon.</p>

<dd><p>execute the current inner transaction group. Fail if executing this group would exceed the inner transaction limit, or if any transaction in the group fails.
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">itxn_submit</span></code> resets the current transaction so that it can not be resubmitted. A new <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">itxn_begin</span></code> is required to prepare another inner transaction.</p>
<p>Native TEAL opcode: <a class="reference external" href="https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/dapps/avm/teal/opcodes/v10/#itxn_submit"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">itxn_submit</span></code></a></p>

The error handling scheme to use for encoding errors.
The default is ‘strict’ meaning that encoding errors raise a
UnicodeEncodeError.  Other possible values are ‘ignore’, ‘replace’ and
‘xmlcharrefreplace’ as well as any other name registered with
codecs.register_error that can handle UnicodeEncodeErrors.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.endswith">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">endswith</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.endswith" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.endswith(suffix[, start[, end]]) -&gt; bool</p>
<p>Return True if S ends with the specified suffix, False otherwise.
With optional start, test S beginning at that position.
With optional end, stop comparing S at that position.
suffix can also be a tuple of strings to try.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.expandtabs">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">expandtabs</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.expandtabs" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy where all tab characters are expanded using spaces.</p>
<p>If tabsize is not given, a tab size of 8 characters is assumed.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.find">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">find</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.find" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.find(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the lowest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Return -1 on failure.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.format">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">format</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.format" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.format(*args, **kwargs) -&gt; str</p>
<p>Return a formatted version of S, using substitutions from args and kwargs.
The substitutions are identified by braces (‘{’ and ‘}’).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.format_map">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">format_map</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.format_map" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.format_map(mapping) -&gt; str</p>
<p>Return a formatted version of S, using substitutions from mapping.
The substitutions are identified by braces (‘{’ and ‘}’).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.index">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">index</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.index" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.index(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the lowest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Raises ValueError when the substring is not found.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.isalnum">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isalnum</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.isalnum" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is an alpha-numeric string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is alpha-numeric if all characters in the string are alpha-numeric and
there is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.isalpha">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isalpha</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.isalpha" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is an alphabetic string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is alphabetic if all characters in the string are alphabetic and there
is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.isascii">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isascii</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.isascii" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if all characters in the string are ASCII, False otherwise.</p>
<p>ASCII characters have code points in the range U+0000-U+007F.
Empty string is ASCII too.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.isdecimal">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isdecimal</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.isdecimal" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a decimal string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is a decimal string if all characters in the string are decimal and
there is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.isdigit">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isdigit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.isdigit" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a digit string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is a digit string if all characters in the string are digits and there
is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.isidentifier">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isidentifier</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.isidentifier" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a valid Python identifier, False otherwise.</p>
<p>Call keyword.iskeyword(s) to test whether string s is a reserved identifier,
such as “def” or “class”.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.islower">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">islower</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.islower" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a lowercase string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is lowercase if all cased characters in the string are lowercase and
there is at least one cased character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.isnumeric">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isnumeric</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.isnumeric" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a numeric string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is numeric if all characters in the string are numeric and there is at
least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.isprintable">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isprintable</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.isprintable" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is printable, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is printable if all of its characters are considered printable in
repr() or if it is empty.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.isspace">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isspace</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.isspace" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a whitespace string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is whitespace if all characters in the string are whitespace and there
is at least one character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.istitle">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">istitle</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.istitle" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is a title-cased string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>In a title-cased string, upper- and title-case characters may only
follow uncased characters and lowercase characters only cased ones.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.isupper">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">isupper</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.isupper" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return True if the string is an uppercase string, False otherwise.</p>
<p>A string is uppercase if all cased characters in the string are uppercase and
there is at least one cased character in the string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.join">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">join</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.join" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Concatenate any number of strings.</p>
<p>The string whose method is called is inserted in between each given string.
The result is returned as a new string.</p>
<p>Example: ‘.’.join([‘ab’, ‘pq’, ‘rs’]) -&gt; ‘ab.pq.rs’</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.ljust">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">ljust</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.ljust" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a left-justified string of length width.</p>
<p>Padding is done using the specified fill character (default is a space).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.lower">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">lower</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.lower" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string converted to lowercase.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.lstrip">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">lstrip</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.lstrip" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string with leading whitespace removed.</p>
<p>If chars is given and not None, remove characters in chars instead.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.partition">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">partition</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.partition" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Partition the string into three parts using the given separator.</p>
<p>This will search for the separator in the string.  If the separator is found,
returns a 3-tuple containing the part before the separator, the separator
itself, and the part after it.</p>
<p>If the separator is not found, returns a 3-tuple containing the original string
and two empty strings.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.removeprefix">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">removeprefix</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.removeprefix" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a str with the given prefix string removed if present.</p>
<p>If the string starts with the prefix string, return string[len(prefix):].
Otherwise, return a copy of the original string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.removesuffix">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">removesuffix</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.removesuffix" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a str with the given suffix string removed if present.</p>
<p>If the string ends with the suffix string and that suffix is not empty,
return string[:-len(suffix)]. Otherwise, return a copy of the original
string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.replace">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">replace</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.replace" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy with all occurrences of substring old replaced by new.</p>
<p>count
Maximum number of occurrences to replace.
-1 (the default value) means replace all occurrences.</p>
<p>If the optional argument count is given, only the first count occurrences are
replaced.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.rfind">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rfind</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.rfind" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.rfind(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the highest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Return -1 on failure.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.rindex">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rindex</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.rindex" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.rindex(sub[, start[, end]]) -&gt; int</p>
<p>Return the highest index in S where substring sub is found,
such that sub is contained within S[start:end].  Optional
arguments start and end are interpreted as in slice notation.</p>
<p>Raises ValueError when the substring is not found.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.rjust">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rjust</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.rjust" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a right-justified string of length width.</p>
<p>Padding is done using the specified fill character (default is a space).</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.rpartition">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rpartition</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.rpartition" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Partition the string into three parts using the given separator.</p>
<p>This will search for the separator in the string, starting at the end. If
the separator is found, returns a 3-tuple containing the part before the
separator, the separator itself, and the part after it.</p>
<p>If the separator is not found, returns a 3-tuple containing two empty strings
and the original string.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.rsplit">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rsplit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.rsplit" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a list of the substrings in the string, using sep as the separator string.</p>
<p>sep
The separator used to split the string.</p>
<div class="highlight-none notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>When set to None (the default value), will split on any whitespace
character (including \n \r \t \f and spaces) and will discard
empty strings from the result.
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>maxsplit
Maximum number of splits.
-1 (the default value) means no limit.</p>
<p>Splitting starts at the end of the string and works to the front.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.rstrip">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">rstrip</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.rstrip" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string with trailing whitespace removed.</p>
<p>If chars is given and not None, remove characters in chars instead.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.split">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">split</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.split" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a list of the substrings in the string, using sep as the separator string.</p>
<p>sep
The separator used to split the string.</p>
<div class="highlight-none notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span>When set to None (the default value), will split on any whitespace
character (including \n \r \t \f and spaces) and will discard
empty strings from the result.
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>maxsplit
Maximum number of splits.
-1 (the default value) means no limit.</p>
<p>Splitting starts at the front of the string and works to the end.</p>
<p>Note, str.split() is mainly useful for data that has been intentionally
delimited.  With natural text that includes punctuation, consider using
the regular expression module.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.splitlines">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">splitlines</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.splitlines" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a list of the lines in the string, breaking at line boundaries.</p>
<p>Line breaks are not included in the resulting list unless keepends is given and
true.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.startswith">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">startswith</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.startswith" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>S.startswith(prefix[, start[, end]]) -&gt; bool</p>
<p>Return True if S starts with the specified prefix, False otherwise.
With optional start, test S beginning at that position.
With optional end, stop comparing S at that position.
prefix can also be a tuple of strings to try.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.strip">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">strip</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.strip" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string with leading and trailing whitespace removed.</p>
<p>If chars is given and not None, remove characters in chars instead.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.swapcase">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">swapcase</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.swapcase" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Convert uppercase characters to lowercase and lowercase characters to uppercase.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.title">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">title</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.title" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a version of the string where each word is titlecased.</p>
<p>More specifically, words start with uppercased characters and all remaining
cased characters have lower case.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.translate">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">translate</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.translate" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Replace each character in the string using the given translation table.</p>
<p>table
Translation table, which must be a mapping of Unicode ordinals to
Unicode ordinals, strings, or None.</p>
<p>The table must implement lookup/indexing via <strong>getitem</strong>, for instance a
dictionary or list.  If this operation raises LookupError, the character is
left untouched.  Characters mapped to None are deleted.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.upper">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">upper</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.upper" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Return a copy of the string converted to uppercase.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.VrfVerify.zfill">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">zfill</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.VrfVerify.zfill" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Pad a numeric string with zeros on the left, to fill a field of the given width.</p>
<p>The string is never truncated.</p>
</dd></dl>

</dd></dl>

<dl class="py function">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.addw">

<dl class="py function">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.base64_decode">
<span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">algopy.op.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">base64_decode</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">e</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.Base64" title="algopy.op.Base64"><span class="pre">algopy.op.Base64</span></a></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">a</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bytes</span></a></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">/</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.base64_decode" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>decode A which was base64-encoded using <em>encoding</em> E. Fail if A is not base64 encoded with encoding E
<em>Warning</em>: Usage should be restricted to very rare use cases. In almost all cases, smart contracts should directly handle non-encoded byte-strings. This opcode should only be used in cases where base64 is the only available option, e.g. interoperability with a third-party that only signs base64 strings.</p>
<p>Decodes A using the base64 encoding E. Specify the encoding with an immediate arg either as URL and Filename Safe (<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">URLEncoding</span></code>) or Standard (<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">StdEncoding</span></code>). See <a class="reference external" href="https://rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc4648.html#section-4">RFC 4648 sections 4 and 5</a>. It is assumed that the encoding ends with the exact number of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">=</span></code> padding characters as required by the RFC. When padding occurs, any unused pad bits in the encoding must be set to zero or the decoding will fail. The special cases of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">\n</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">\r</span></code> are allowed but completely ignored. An error will result when attempting to decode a string with a character that is not in the encoding alphabet or not one of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">=</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">\r</span></code>, or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">\n</span></code>.</p>
<dl class="myst field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><strong>e</strong> (<a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.op.Base64" title="algopy.op.Base64"><em>Base64</em></a>) – encoding index</p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Native TEAL opcode: <a class="reference external" href="https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/dapps/avm/teal/opcodes/v10/#base64_decode"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">base64_decode</span></code></a></p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py function">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.op.min_balance">
<span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">algopy.op.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">min_balance</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">a</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.Account" title="algopy.Account"><span class="pre">algopy.Account</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="pre">algopy.UInt64</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">int</span></a></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">/</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="pre">algopy.UInt64</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.op.min_balance" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>minimum required balance for account A, in microalgos. Required balance is affected by ASA, App, and Box usage. When creating or opting into an app, the minimum balance grows before the app code runs, therefore the increase is visible there. When deleting or closing out, the minimum balance decreases after the app executes. Changes caused by inner transactions or box usage are observable immediately following the opcode effecting the change.
params: Txn.Accounts offset (or, since v4, an <em>available</em> account address), <em>available</em> application id (or, since v4, a Txn.ForeignApps offset). Return: value.</p>
<p>Native TEAL opcode: <a class="reference external" href="https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/dapps/avm/teal/opcodes/v10/#min_balance"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">min_balance</span></code></a></p>
</dd></dl>
